Class ManyInputs

java.lang.Object

Direct Known Subclasses:
And, Or
public abstract class ManyInputs
extends LogicGate

This class adds support for LogicGates with many inputs.

On initialization, the instance has an initial boolean value. On adding or removing inputs, the value changes.

When a input is added, this is registered with the input circuit as a dependent. updateValue() will be called by the input circuit if its boolean value changes. On removal of the input, this is deregistered as dependent with the input circuit.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Jan Dockx

getInputs

getFanIn

public final int getFanIn()

addInput

public final void addInput(LogicCircuit input)

input is added to the set of inputs. If input changes after this call, we will be notified.

Parameters:
input - The logic circuit our boolean value depends upon from now on.

removeInput

public final void removeInput(LogicCircuit input)

input is removed from the set of inputs. We will no longer be notified of changes in the boolean value of input.

Parameters:
dependent - The object no longer to be notified of a change of our boolean value.
input - The logic circuit our boolean value no longer depends on.

inputAdded

protected abstract void inputAdded(LogicCircuit input)

This method is called by addInput(LogicCircuit) when input is added to the set of inputs. Subclasses should implement this method to update the boolean value of this to reflect the extra input.

inputRemoved

protected abstract void inputRemoved(LogicCircuit input)

This method is called by addInput(LogicCircuit) when input is removed from the set of inputs. Subclasses should implement this method to update the boolean value of this to reflect the removal of input.

protected final void updateValue()
Description copied from class: LogicGate

localUpdate

abstract void localUpdate()

This method is to be called by updateValue() to do the actual recalculation of the boolean value.
